Circuit Elements¶

Circuit Elements are defined in SuperPAC as any component you can place in your circuit.

Components¶

Components is the high level class that all components (Analog and Digital, as well as Supplies) inherit. It only defines behaviours that all components share, namely connecting and disconnecting to nodes.

class Component.Component[source]¶

Circuit Component Base class. provides the absolute minimum to meet the definition of a component in a circuit.

connect(Node)[source]¶

Adds a Node to the component’s nodes, if there is a connection available.

disconnect(Node)[source]¶

Removes a Node from the component’s nodes.

setMaxConnections(N)[source]¶

Changes the Max Connections to the supplied value.

Analog¶

Analog Components and each subclass define the characteristics of each type of component. Using these characteristics, an analysis module can set values. No analog component should be performing any sort of calculations of its values. That way, the solving engine can be independent of the component type.

class AnalogComponent.AnalogComponent[source]¶

Class to describe all analog components. Only three types exist: Resistors, Capacitors, and Inductors. This module is designed to be extensible to include other types. Unless overridden by a subclass, Analog components will be limited to two connections. The direction of current flow is left undefined and decided by the analyzer.

class AnalogComponent.Capacitor(C)[source]¶

Class for a capacitor. Impedance expressed in Laplace domain. Capacitance in microFarads.

class AnalogComponent.Inductor(L)[source]¶

Class for an Inductor. Impedance expressed in Laplace domain. Inductance in milliHenrys.

class AnalogComponent.Resistor(R)[source]¶

Class for a resistor. Impedance is a purely proportional relation. Resistance in Ohms.

Supplies¶

Similar to Analog Components, supplies define types of supply. We treat Supplies as

class Supply.ACCurrentSupply(I, F)[source]¶

Class to define an AC Current supply. The voltage supplied is a waveform output with peak current I and frequency F. Calling

Vs = ACCurrentSupply(10, 60)

Will create a 10A 60Hz Voltage supply in the circuit.

class Supply.ACVoltageSupply(V, F)[source]¶

Class to define an AC voltage supply. The voltage supplied is a waveform output with peak voltage V and frequency F. Calling

Vs = ACVoltageSupply(120, 60)

Will create a 120V 60Hz Voltage supply in the circuit.

class Supply.DCCurrentSupply(I)[source]¶

Class to define a DC Current supply. The current specified is the constant output of the supply.

class Supply.DCVoltageSupply(V)[source]¶

Class to define a DC voltage supply. The voltage specified is the constant output of the supply.
